stanzas.1:
The pure, unfailing Word of God
Foundation ever sure#n#Its statutes, precepts and its laws,#n#Are written for the pure.#n#
stanzas.2:
In paradise where man was led,
The word will safely guide;#n#And if he should this law evade,#n#His steps would surely slide.#n#
stanzas.3:
The Holy Sabbath here was made,
Which God did sanctify;#n#And if we would our God obey,#n#We must with this comply.#n#
stanzas.4:
In after times, when Moses liv'd,
This law was ratified#n#And all who keet this holy word,#n#May know they're sanctified.#n#
stanzas.5:
Still farther down the stream of time,
We hear the prophet say#n#Hearken, fear not reproach nor shame,#n#Who keep the seventh day.#n#
stanzas.6:
For thus the Mighty God hath said
To those who truly rest,#n#Thou shalt on the high places ride,#n#And feed among the blest.#n#
stanzas.7:
Here too are they who patient are, 
And keep commandments pure,#n#They'll in the Holy City share,#n#If to the end endure.#n#
stanzas.8:
Then let us still pursue this road,
Till we fair Canaan gain,#n#Then we shall walk the street of gold,#n#And in that rest remain.#n#

stanzas.1:
Lo! an angel loud proclaiming,
With the gospel of good news,#n#To every kindred, tongue and people;#n#Fear the Lord; give glory due;#n#Proclamation#n#Of the hour of judgement near.#n#
stanzas.2:
Lo! another angel follows,
With another solemn cry!#n#Babylon the great is fallen,#n#Peals like thunder through the sky :#n#Let "thy people,"#n#Now forsake her POIS'NOUS CREEDS.#n#
stanzas.3:
Yet, a third and solemn message,
Now proclaims a final doom;#n#All who "worship Beast or Image;"#n#Soon shall drink the wrath of God#n#Without mixture,#n#Mercy now no longer pleads.#n#
stanzas.4:
Here are they, who now are waiting,
And have patience to endure;#n#While the DRAGON'S hosts are raging,#n#These confide in God secure#n#Faith of Jesus;#n#And COMMANDMENTS, keep them pure.#n#
stanzas.5:
Hear a voice from heav'n proclaiming,
"Write" the message, "firm decree,"#n#Bless'd are they, who die in Jesus,#n#"From hence forth" for ever be#n#The Spirit sanctions,#n#And the Saints ADORE His LAW. #n#

stanzas.1:
We speak of the joys of the blest—
Of that country so bright and so fair;#n#And oft are its glories confest;#n#But what must it be to be there?#n#We speak of its pathway of gold;#n#Of its walls deck'd with jewels so rare,#n#Of its wonders and pleasures untold#n#But what must it be to be there?#n#
stanzas.2:
We speak of its freedom from sin,
From sorrow, temptation and care,#n#From trials without and within#n#But what must it be to be there?#n#We speak of its service of love;#n#Of the robes which the glorified wear;#n#Of the Church of the first born above,#n#But what must it be to be there?#n#
stanzas.3:
Do Thou 'midst temptation or wo,
Still for heaven my Sprit prepare;#n#And shortly I also shall know,#n#And feel what it is to be there.#n#Then o'er the bright fields we shall roam,#n#In glory celestial and fair,#n#With saints and with angels at home,#n#And Jesus himself will be there.#n#

stanzas.1:
When Jesus Christ was here below,
He taught his people what to do:#n#And if we would his precepts keep,#n#We must attend to washing feet.#n#For on that night he was betray'd,#n#He for us all a pattern laid#n#Soon as his supper He did eat,#n#He rose and wash'd his brethren's feet.#n#
stanzas.2:
The Lord who made the earth and sky,
Arose and laid his garments by;#n#And wash'd their feet to show that we;#n#Like Christ, should always humble be.#n#He wash'd them all, tho' all were clean,#n#Save Judas, who was full of sin.#n#May none of us, like Judas, sell#n#Our Lord for gold, and go to hell. #n#
stanzas.3:
Said Peter, Lord, it shall not be;
Thou shalt not stoop to washing me#n#Oh! that no Christian now may say,#n#I cannot Jesus' word obey.#n#Ye call me Lord and Master too;#n#Then do as I have done to you;#n#All my commands and sayings keep,#n#And show your love by washing feet#n#
stanzas.4:
Ye shall be happy, if ye know
And do these things, by faith below;#n#For I'll protect you till I come,#n#And then I'll take you to your home#n#The Lord of glory stoops to men,#n#And an example sets for them#n#If in humility complete,#n#Salute the saints and wash their feet.#n#

stanzas.1:
How sweet to reflect on those joys that await me
In yon blissful region, the haven of rest,#n#Where bright holy angels with welcome shall greet me.#n#And lead me to mansions prepar'd for the blest.#n#Encircled in light, and with glory enshrouded,#n#My happiness perfect, my mind's sky unclouded,#n#I'll bathe in the ocean of pleasure unbounded,#n#And range with delight through the Eden of Love.#n#
stanzas.2:
While angelic legions, with harps tun'd celestial,
Harmoniously join in the concert of praise,#n#The saints, as they flock from the regions terrestrial,#n#In loud hallejujahs their voices will raise#n#Then songs to the Lamb shall re—echo thro' heaven,#n#My soul will respond, to Immanuel be given,#n#All glory, all honor, all might and dominion,#n#Who brought us through grace to the Eden of Love#n#
stanzas.3:
Then hail, blessed state! hail, ye songsters of glory!
Ye harpers of bliss, soon I'll meet you above,#n#And join your full choir in rehearsing the story,#n#“Salvation from sorrow, through Jesus' love:"#n#Though 'prison'd in earth, yet, by anticipation,#n#Already my soul feels a sweet prelibation#n#Of joys that await me, when freed from probation;#n#My heart's now in heaven, the Eden, of Love. #n#

stanzas.1:
Behold a light appears,
The holy Sabbath day,#n#And magnified so clear,#n#That none may need to stray;#n#Though small at first, as sun beam's ray,#n#Its strength ascends to perfect day.#n#
stanzas.2:
It is the message clear
Ascending from the east,#n#God's servants now appear#n#Who will not worship "BEAST;"#n#Four angels hold the winds reveal'd,#n#Until God's servants all are seal'd.#n#
stanzas.3:
Hebrews in Egypt's land
Must all receive a sign,#n#When forth from Pharaoh's hand#n#Deliverance was design'd;#n#A sign, a token, thus shall be,#n#Before the earth and heavens flee.#n#
stanzas.4:
The Sabbath is a sign,
A mark which all may see,#n#And sure will draw a line#n#When servants all are seal'd,#n#And while destruction’s in the land#n#This mark will guard the waiting band.#n#
stanzas.5:
Then wrath in vengeance comes,
The great and dreadful day!#n#God's voice in thunder tones,#n#Shakes heaven and earth and sea;#n#Ye living saints who faithful be,#n#No plague shall e'er come nigh to thee.#n#
stanzas.6:
O God, the living God,
Do thou the seal apply,#n#And from destruction's rod,#n#Oh! keep us lest we die;#n#And while the storm of wrath descends,#n#Oh ! hide us, till the earth be cleans'd.#n#

stanzas.1:
Hail, partners in the Advent band!
Your race is almost run#n#God’s led you with his own right hand, #n#Since looking for his Son.#n#All hail, ye lov'd ones of my God,#n#Come listen to my song,#n#While I recount the steps we've trod,#n#Nor shall the strain be long.#n#
stanzas.2:
But, forty—three flew quickly by
And left us toiling here;#n#Then slumber stole upon each eye#n#And closed each listening ear.#n#In forty—four, we heard a cry#n#At midnight pealing forth—#n#Behold, the heavenly Bridegroom's nigh,#n#He'll soon descend to earth.#n#
stanzas.3:
It truly was a solemn cry,
As ever earth did hear#n#Like many waters rushing by,#n#It fell upon the ear.#n#Each virgin rose and trimm'd the lamp,#n#With eager haste went out#n#From north to south, throughout the camp,#n#Was heard one mighty shout.#n#
stanzas.4:
Each heart with solemn rapture swelt'd,
As we proclaim'd the cry—#n#Nor heeded we the scoffs that fell#n#From many a passer by.#n#Like ancient men of Galilee,#n#We gaz'd into the sky,#n#Doubtless our Lord we soon should see#n#Descending from on high.#n#
stanzas.5:
Our longing eyes were rais'd in vain,
To meet Him in the air,#n#For 'twas not so, the Bridegroom came,#n#His Bride's not here, but there.#n#There to the fair Jerusalem,#n#Unseen by mortal eye,#n#Jesus our King and Priest did come, #n#Thus answering to the cry.#n#
stanzas.6:
Tis there, within the pearly gates,
A marriage feast is spread#n#'Twas purchas'd for the scatter'd saints#n#By Christ, their living Head.#n#Then let us patient wait awhile,#n#Till we those joys do see;#n#There we shall bask beneath his smile#n#To all eternity.#n#

stanzas.1:
O hail, happy day, that speaks our trials ended,
Our Lord has come to take us home;#n#O hail, happy day;#n#No more by doubts or fears distress'd,#n#We now shall gain our promis'd rest,#n#And be for ever blest; O hail, happy day.#n#
stanzas.2:
Swell loud the glad note, our bondage now is over;
The jubilee proclaims us free;#n#O hail, happy day;#n#The day that brings a sweet release,#n#That crowns our Jesus Prince#n#And bids our sorrows cease;#n#O hail, happy day.#n#
stanzas.3:
O hail, happy day, that ends our tears and sorrow,
That brings us joy without alloy,#n#O hail, happy day#n#There peace shall wave her scepter high#n#And love's fair banner greet the eye,#n#Proclaiming victory; O hail, happy day.#n#
stanzas.4:
We hail thy bright beams, O morn of Zion’s glory,
Thy blessed light breaks on our sight,#n#O hail, happy day;#n#Fair Beulah’s fields before us rise,#n#And sweetly burst upon our eyes,#n#The joys of Paradise; O hail happy day.#n#
stanzas.5:
Thrice hail, happy day, when earth shall smile in gladness,
And Eden bloom o'er nature’s tomb,#n#O hail, happy day;#n#Where life's pellucid waters glide,#n#Safe by the dear Redeemer's side,#n#For ever we'll abide; O hail, happy day. #n#

stanzas.1:
We have heard from the bright, the holy land,
We have heard, and our hearts are glad;#n# For we were a lonely pilgrim band,#n#And weary, and worn, and sad.#n#They tell us the pilgrims have a dwelling there—#n#No longer are homeless ones;#n#And we know that the goodly land is fair;#n#Where life’s pure river runs.#n#
stanzas.2:
They say green fields are waving there,
That never a blight shall know;#n#And the deserts wild are blooming fair.#n#And the roses of Sharon grow.#n#There are lovely birds in the bowers green—#n#Their songs are blithe and sweet;#n#And their warblings gushing ever new#n#The angel’s harpings greet.#n#
stanzas.3:
We have heard of the palms, the robes, the crowns,
And the silvery band in white;#n#Of the city fair, with pearly gates,#n#All radiant with light.#n#We have heard of the angels there and saints,#n#With their harps of gold, how they sing;#n#Of the mount with the fruitful tree of life,#n#Of the leaves that healing brings.#n#
stanzas.4:
The King of that country, He is fair,
He’s the joy and light of the place!#n#In His beauty we shall behold Him there,#n#And bask in His smiling face.#n#We’ll be there; we’ll be there in a little while,#n#We’ll join the pure and the blest;#n#We’ll have the palm, the robe, the crown,#n#And forever be at rest.#n#

stanzas.1:
Oh, spare Thy people, Lord,
And bring them full salvation;#n#Fulfill Thy faithful Word,#n#Rescue the sleeping nation.#n#Thou voice of God shout from on high;#n#The signal give for reaping;#n#Come Thou and reap the harvest dry;#n#Oh gather all the sleeping:#n#Spare now the “remnant” Lord, #n#The foe doth yet persue them,#n#Oh for Thy blessed word,#n#Do Thou with strength renew them.#n#
stanzas.2:
Oh, may thy kingdom come,
All power and dominion;#n#Bring now the faithful home,#n#On bright seraphic pinion#n#We're tried,
stanzas.3:
Oh! may the "City" come
Down from the opening heaven#n#The New Jerusalem,#n#Oh, may it now be given!#n#Its gates of pearl, its streets of gold,#n#Blaze with Thy brightest glory#n#The holy seers have raptur'd told#n#The new Creation's story!#n#Oh, may it now descend,#n#The City of foundations,#n#In triumph ne'er to end;#n#Rule Thou the "angry nations."#n#

stanzas.1:
Our Father who in heaven art,
Hallowed be thy name;#n#Thy kingdom come, Thy will be done,#n#In heav'n and earth the same.#n#DOUBLE CHORUS.#n#Come, my Saviour, O my Saviour,#n#Come and bless thy people now,#n#While at thy feet we humbly bow,#n#O come and save us now.#n#Then will we sing our suff'rings o'er,#n#And praise thee evermore;#n#Then will we sing our suff'rings o'er,#n#And praise thee evermore.#n#
stanzas.2:
Give us this day our daily bread ; 
Our trespasses forgive;#n#As we forgive our fellow—men,#n#May we thy grace receive.#n#Come, my Saviour, &c.#n#
stanzas.3:
And in temptation leave us not;
From evil us defend;#n#For Thine, O Lord, the kingdom is,#n#For ever, without end.#n#Come, my Saviour, &c.#n#
stanzas.4:
Thine is the power, O Lord, to bring
The kingdom down to men;#n#Thine is the glory evermore,#n#And kingdom without end.#n#Come, my Saviour, &c.#n#
stanzas.5:
In that glad day shall all thy saints
A joyful tribute bring,#n#Of praise and power, of joy and song,#n#To their exalted King.#n#Come, my Saviour, &c.#n#

stanzas.1:
Time now is closing, Jesus will come;
Signs are fulfilling, earth's pillars groan:#n#Hark! hear the trumpet calls come home—#n#See earth reeling to her final doom.#n#
stanzas.2:
See slumbering millions rise from the earth;
Christ calls his people from south, from north—#n#Come home, my people, time is no more,#n#I've wash'd your robes white, your conflicts are o'er#n#
stanzas.3:
Hastening to see Thee, my soul would rise
To meet my Saviour in yonder skies;#n#With all the ransom'd who've gone before,#n#There I shall hail Thee on that peaceful shore,#n#

stanzas.1:
Jesus our Saviour says—I will appear!
Have you faith?#n#My trumpet is sounding majestic and clear!#n#Have you faith?#n#The faithful alone I come to see,#n#And they shall live and reign with me,#n#Only have faith!#n#
stanzas.2:
Prophets have spoken, their words are fulfill'd,
Have you faith?#n#My word is establish'd, your anguish is still'd,#n#Have you faith?#n#The plan of salvation the faith's eye will see,#n#And live for ever and reign with Me,#n#Only have faith!#n#
stanzas.3:
Though I should tarry, be not dismay'd,
Have you faith?#n#The judgement is coming o'er all I've said,#n#Have you faith?#n#The doubt to the bondage, the faith, to the free,#n#To live for ever and reign with me,#n#Only have faith!#n#

stanzas.1:
Hosannah! hark, the melody,
Strikes sweetly on my ravish'd ear!#n#The constellations make reply#n#In echoes from each distant sphere,#n#Till all the wide expansion rings#n#With "live for ever, King of kings."#n#He comes! He comes! The heavens rend!#n#Floods clap your hands! Ye mountains joy!#n#Forests in glad obeisance bend!#n#Earth, raise your hallelujahs high,#n#Let Zion wake the lofty strain#n#“Live, King of kings, for ever reign!”#n#
stanzas.2:
Ripe is the vintage of the earth;
Its clustering grapes are round and full#n#And vengeance, vengeance bursts to birth,#n#Sudden and irresistible!#n#Messiah comes to tread amain,#n#The wine—press of the battle—plain.#n#
stanzas.3:
The cry is up, the strife begun,
The struggle of the mighty ones; #n#And Armageddon's day cones on,#n#The carnival of Slaughter's sons;#n#War lifts his helmet to his brow#n#O God, protect thy people now!#n#
stanzas.4:
Assemble quickly fowls of air!
Come to the supper of the Lord#n#The great ones of the earth prepare#n#To reap the harvest of the sword;#n#And captains' flesh shall be your food,#n#And ye shall drink of heroes' blood.#n#
stanzas.5:
Yea, come, O king, and take the spoil;
With thy confederates share the prey#n#Ha! ha! Death grins a ghastly smile;”#n#The morning dawns—and where are they?#n#The flames, the flames, great Autocrat,#n#Spread o'er thee in Jehosophat.#n#
stanzas.6:
The graves are cleav'd! the saints arise!
The resurrection of the just!#n#And now, unto their kindred skies,#n#Up leap the tenants of the dust!#n#They rise to meet their Lord in air,#n#And tune their hallelujahs there.#n#

14.title: THIS WORLD IS NOT MY HOME.

stanzas.1:
Farewell! farewell! to all below,
My Jesus calls and I must go:#n#I'll launch my boat upon the sea,#n#This land is not the land for me.#n#This world is not my home;#n#This world is not my home;#n#This world is all a wilderness;#n#This world is not my home.#n#
stanzas.2:
I found the winding path of sin
A rugged path to travel in;#n#Beyond this fading world I see#n#The land the Saviour bought for me.#n#This world is not my home, &c.#n#
stanzas.3:
Farewell! my friends ! I'll not stay here—
The home I seek will soon appear;#n#Where Christ is not, I cannot be;#n#This land is not the land for me.#n#This world is not my home, &c. #n#
stanzas.4:
Praise be to God our hope's on high;
The angels sing and so do I#n#Where seraphs bow and bend the knee,#n#O that's the land—the land for me.#n#This world is not my home, &c.#n#

stanzas.1:
A soldier, Lord, thou hast me made
Thou art my Captain, Priest and Head;#n#And under thee I sure will fight#n#The fight of faith with all my might.#n#The cross all stain'd with hallow'd blood,#n#The ensign of our conquering Lord,#n#The Christian soldier's standard is,#n#And I will fight for King Jesus.#n#
stanzas.2:
Then, O my Lord, keep me, I pray',
That I may run the narrow way,#n#And front my duty ne'er depart.#n#But live to Christ with all my heart;#n#Help me to walk in humbleness#n#March in the way of holiness.#n#Oh, make me pure and spotless too,#n#And fit to stand the grand review.#n#
stanzas.3:
That when our general shall come,
With sound of trumpet, not of drum,#n#'Tis then our well dress'd ranks shall stand#n#In full review at God's right hand.#n#And when our foes shall get the route,#n#Anti Jesus wheels them left about,#n#Then we'll march up the golden street,#n#And ground our arms at Jesus' feet.#n#
stanzas.4:
The war is o'er, and we are free
To join the blood—wash'd company#n#Our wages shall be harps of old,#n#And songs of praise that can't be told.#n#There we shall drink rich drafts of wine#n#The band of music we shall join,#n#And hallelujah's highest key#n#Shall be our theme eternally.#n#

stanzas.1:
The chariot! The chariot! Its wheels roll in fire,
As the Lord cometh down in the pomp of His ire #n#Lo, self moving it drives on its pathway of cloud,#n#And the heavens with the burden of Godhead are bow'd.#n#
stanzas.2:
The glory, the glory around him are pour'd,
Mighty hosts of the angels that wait on the Lord;#n#And the glorified saints and the martyrs are there,#n#And there all who the palm—wreaths of victory wear.#n#
stanzas.3:
The trumpet! The trumpet! The dead have all heard
Lo, the depths o
stanzas.4:
The judgement! The judgement! The thrones are all set,
Where the Lamb and the white vested elders are met;#n#There all flesh is at once in the sight of the Lord,#n#And the doom of eternity hangs on his word.#n#
stanzas.5:
O mercy! O mercy! Look down from above;
Great Creator, on us, thy sad children with love;#n#When beneath to their darkness the wicked are driven,#n#May the justified saints find a ransom in heaven.#n#

stanzas.1:
The last lovely morning
All blooming and fair,#n#Is fast onward fleeting,#n#And soon will appear!#n#While the mighty, mighty, mighty, trump#n#Sounds “Come, come away!”#n#O! let us be ready#n#To hail the glad day.#n#
stanzas.2:
And when that bright morning
In splendor shall dawn,#n#Our tears will be ended,#n#Our sorrows all gone.#n#While the mighty. &c.#n#
stanzas.3:
The Bridegroom from glory
To earth shall descend ;#n#Ten thousand bright angels#n#Around him attend.#n#While the mighty, &c.#n#
stanzas.4:
The graves will be open'd, 
The dead will arise,#n#And with the Redeemer#n#Mount up to the skies.#n#While the mighty, &c.#n#

stanzas.1:
I'm a lonely trav'ller here,
Weary, opprest;#n#But my journey's end is near,#n#Soon I shall rest.#n#Dark and dreary is the way,#n#Toiling I've come—#n#Ask me not with you to stay—#n#Yonder's my home.#n#
stanzas.2:
I'm a weary trav'ller here,
I must go on,#n#For my journey's end is near—#n#I must be gone.#n#Brighter joys than earth can give;#n#Win me away;#n#Pleasures, that for ever live—#n#I cannot stay.#n#
stanzas.3:
I'm a trav'ller to a land
Where all is fair;#n#Where is seen no broken band—#n#All, all are there;#n#Where no tear shall ever fall,#n#Nor heart be sad;#n#Where the glory is for all,#n#And all are glad.#n#
stanzas.4:
I'm a trav'ller, and I go
Where all is fair;#n#Farewell all I've lov'd below—#n#I must be there.#n#Worldly honors, hopes and gain,#n#All I resign;#n#Welcome sorrow, grief and pain.#n#If heav'n be mine. #n#
stanzas.5:
I'm a trav'ller—call me not—
Upward's my way;#n#Yonder is my rest and lot,#n#I cannot stay.#n#Farewell earthly pleasures all,#n#Pilgrim I'll roam,#n#Hail me not—in vain you call—#n#Yonder's my home.#n#

stanzas.1:
Holy Bible! Book divine!
Precious treasure, thou art mine#n#Mine, to tell me whence I came;#n#Mine, to teach one what I am;#n#Mine, to chide me when I rove;#n#Mine, to show a Saviour's love;#n#Mine, art thou, to guide my feet;#n#Mine to judge, condemn, acquit.#n#
stanzas.2:
Mine, to comfort in distress,
If the Holy Spirit bless;#n#Mine, to show, by living faith,#n#Man can triumph over death;#n#Mine, to tell of joys to come,#n#And the rebel sinner's doom;#n#

stanzas.1:
Gracious Father, guard thy children
From the foes' destructive pow’r;#n#Save, O save them Lord, from falling#n#In this dark and trying hour.#n#Thou wilt surely prove thy people,#n#All our graces must be tried;#n#But thy word illumes our pathway,#n#And in God we still confide.#n#
stanzas.2:
We are in the time of waiting;
Soon we shall behold our Lord,#n#Wafted far away from sorrow,#n#To receive our rich reward.#n#Keep us, Lord, till thine appearing,#n#Pure, unspotted, from the world;#n#Let thy Holy Spirit cheer us, #n#Till thy banner is unfurl'd.#n#
stanzas.3:
With what joyful exultation
Shall the saints thy banner see,#n#When the Lord for whom we've waited,#n#Shall proclaim the Jubilee:#n#Freedom from this world's pollutions;#n#Freedom from all sin and pain;#n#Freedom from the wiles of Satan,#n#And from Death's destructive reign.#n#

stanzas.1:
Christian, thy warfare soon will be o'er;
Oh, do not fear, do not fear,#n#Soon thou shalt rest where thy foes come no more—#n#Be of good cheer, of good cheer.#n#What though the night be so dreary and long,#n#What though thy foes be unwearied and strong,#n#Soon thou shalt join in the conqueror's song—#n#Be of good cheer, of good cheer.#n#
stanzas.2:
What though the billows of life darkly roll,
Oh, do not fear, do not fear;#n#Friends all forsake thee, and cares press thy soul,#n#Be of good cheer, of good cheer.#n#Christian, remember that Christ loves thee still#n#Only be faithful, and do Jesus' will,#n#Soon thou wilt stand with Him on Zion's hill—#n#Be of good cheer, of good cheer.#n#
stanzas.3:
Christian, the angels will soon come for thee,
Oh, do not fear, do not fear;#n#He whom thou lovest in glory thou'lt see—#n#Be of good cheer, of good cheer.#n#Oh, if thou would'st to the end firm endure,#n#Keep thy robe holy and spotless and pure,#n#Victorious faith will make Canaan sure—#n#Be of good cheer, of good cheer.#n#
stanzas.4:
Christian, the shadows will soon flee away;
Oh, do not fear, do not fear;#n#Then thou wilt enter an eternal day,#n#Be of good cheer, of good cheer.#n#In the "bright kingdom” for ever to dwell,#n#Join angel choirs, and the rich anthem swell;#n#Bid to thy sorrow a long, long farewell!#n#Be of good cheer, of good cheer. #n#

stanzas.1:
Here o'er the earth as a stranger I roam,
Here is no rest—is no rest ;#n#Here as a pilgrim I wander alone,#n#Yet I am blest—I am blest.#n#CHORUS.#n#For I look forward to that glorious day,#n#When sin and sorrow will vanish away,#n#My heart doth leap while I hear Jesus say,#n#There, there is rent—there is rest.#n#
stanzas.2:
Here fierce temptations beset me around;
Here is no rest—is no rest;#n#Here am I griev'd while my foes me surround;#n#Yet I am blest—I am blest.#n#CHORUS.#n#Let them revile me, and scoff at my name,#n#Laugh at my weeping—endeavor to shame;#n#I will go forward, for this is my theme;#n#There, there is rest—there is rest.#n#
stanzas.3:
Here are afflictions and trials severe;
Here is no rest—is no rest;#n#Here I must part with the friends I hold dear;#n#Yet I am blest—I am blest.#n#CHORUS.#n#Sweet is the promise I read in his word;#n#Blessed are they who have died in the Lord;#n#They will be call'd to receive their reward;—#n#Then there is rest—there is rest.#n#
stanzas.4:
This world of cares is a wilderness state,
Here is no rest—is no rest;#n#Here I must bear from the world all its hate—#n#Yet I am blest—I am blest.#n#CHORUS.#n#Soon shall I be from the wicked released,#n#Soon shall the weary for ever be blest,#n#Soon shall I lean upon Jesus' breast—#n#Then there is rest—there is rest.#n#

stanzas.1:
Mark that pilgrim—lowly bending,
At the shrine of prayer—ascending,#n#Praise and sighs together blending,#n#From his lips in mournful strain;#n#Glowing with sincere contrition,#n#And with childlike, blest submission, #n#Ever riseth this petition#n#“Jesus, come—oh! come to reign."#n#
stanzas.2:
List again;—the low earth sigheth,
And the blood of martyrs crieth#n#From its bosom, where there lieth#n#Millions upon millions slain;#n#"Lord, how long, ere thy word given,#n#All the wicked shall be driven#n#From the earth by bolts of heaven I#n#Jesus come—oh ! come to reign."#n#
stanzas.3:
Kingdoms now are reeling, falling,
Nations lie in wo appalling,#n#On their sages vainly calling#n#All these wonders to explain;#n#While the slain around are lying,#n#God's own little flock are sighing,#n#And in secret places crying,#n#“Jesus come—oh! come to reign."#n#
stanzas.4:
Here the wicked live securely,
Of to-morrow boasting surely,#n#While from those who're walking purely#n#They extort dishonest gain;#n#Yea, the meek are burden'd, driven;#n#Want and care to them are given,#n#But they lift the cry to Heaven,#n#“Jesus come—oh! come to reign."#n#
stanzas.5:
Christian, CHEER THEE—land is nearing,
Still be hopeful—nothing fearing,#n#Soon in majesty appearing,#n#You'll behold the Lamb once slain;#n#Oh

stanzas.1:
Bright scenes of glory strike my sense,
And all my passions capture;#n#Eternal beauties round me shine,#n#Infusing warmest rapture.#n#I dive in pleasures deep and full,#n#In swelling waves of glory;#n#And feel my Saviour in my soul#n#And groan to tell my story. #n#
stanzas.2:
I feast on honey, milk and wine,
I drink perpetual sweetness;#n#Mount Zion's odours cheer my mind,#n#While Christ unfolds his glory,#n#No mortal tongue can show my joys,#n#Nor can an angel tell them;#n#Ten thousand times surpassing all#n#Terrestrial worlds or emblems.#n#
stanzas.3:
My captivated spirits fly
Through shining worlds of beauty;#n#Dissolv'd in blushes, loud I cry,#n#In praises loud and mighty,#n#And here I'll sing and swell the strains#n#Of harmony, delighted;#n#And with the millions learn the notes#n#Of saints in Christ united.#n#
stanzas.4:
When earth and seas shall pass away,
And all their glory vanish;#n#When Christ shall come on earth to reign,#n#And all the wicked perish,#n#My joys refin'd, shall higher shine,#n#With heaven's radiant glory,#n#And tell through one eternal day,#n#Love's all immortal story.#n#

stanzas.1:
The pure testimony put forth in the Spirit,
Cuts like a sharp two-edged sword,#n#And hypocrites now are most sorely tormented,#n#Because they're condemn'd by the word.#n#The pure testimony discovers the dross,#n#While wicked professors make light of the cross,#n#And Babylon trembles for fear of her loss.#n#
stanzas.2:
Then blow ye the trumpet in pure testimony,
And let the saints hear it again;#n#O come ye from Babylon, Egypt and Sodom,#n#And make your way over the plain.#n#Come, wash all your robes in the blood of the Lamb,#n#And walk in the Spirit, as Jesus has done,#n#In the pure testimony you will overcome.#n#
stanzas.3:
The world will not persecute those who are like them,
But hold them the same as their own;#n#The pure testimony cries out separation, #n#Which calls you your lives to lay down;#n#Come out from their spirit and practices too;#n#The track of the Saviour keep full in your view,#n#The pure testimony still cut its way through.#n#
stanzas.4:
A battle is coming between the two kingdoms,
The armies are gathering round;#n#The pure testimony and vile persecution,#n#Will come to close battle ere long;#n#Then gird on your armor ye saints of the Lord,#n#And he will direct you by his living word;#n#The pure testimony trill cut like a sword.#n#

stanzas.1:
Be of one mind—give God your hearts;
And of his mercies tell,#n#Which he, through grace, to you imparts,#n#So brethren all farewell.#n#
stanzas.2:
Now live in peace and holy fear
In love strive to excel;#n#For Christ our King will soon appear,#n#So brethren all farewell.#n#
stanzas.3:
The God of love and peace adore,
And on his mercy dwell,#n#We hope to meet on Canaan's shore,#n#So brethren all farewell.#n#

stanzas.1:
The friends that flee when trials come,
Are not the friends for me;#n#Like frighted birds, ah! see how soon—#n#Their place will vacant be.#n#But there's a Friend I dearly love,#n#Who for me left the realms above,#n#And died upon the tree—#n#Oh! that's the Friend for me, &c.#n#
stanzas.2:
This world, with all its fleeting show,
Is not the world for me;#n#'Tis mix'd with many tears of wo,#n#And scenes of misery. #n#But there's a world so pure and fair,#n#And all the saints shall enter there,#n#From sin and sorrow free—#n#Oh! that's the world for me, &c.#n#
stanzas.3:
A city fair, for saints a home,
From God is coming down;#n#His children rest, no more to roam,#n#In New Jerusalem.#n#Oh! Jesus, come! come quickly! come,#n#We long to see our heavenly home#n#Of Immortality—#n#Oh! that's the home for me, &c.#n#

stanzas.1:
The coming events of the kingdom of God,
Cast in glory its shadows before;#n#And my being would leap from its prison'd abode,#n#And the King in his beauty adore.#n#
stanzas.2:
He comes, and the spirit that lingers below;
In the hearts of the chosen and tried,#n#Is quicken'd, and tells, in its mystical flow,#n#The approach of the Bridegroom and Bride.#n#
stanzas.3:
The love, and the joy, and the peace of the blest,
Like the day star, arise in the soul,#n#And we taste the first fruits of the Eden of rest,#n#And we hasten to enter the goal.#n#
stanzas.4:
All glory, all glory, to him that was slain,
Who hath wash'd and redeem'd us to God ;#n#For he cometh with power in his kingdom to reign,#n#And the earth to his sceptre is bow'd.#n#

stanzas.1:
How happy are the little flock,
Who, safe beneath their guardian Rock,#n#In all commotions rest;#n#When war's and tumult's waves run high,#n#Unmov'd above the storm they lie,#n#And lodge in Jesus' breast.#n#
stanzas.2:
Such happiness, O Lord, have we,
By mercy gather'd into thee,#n#Before the floods descend;#n#And while the bursting cloud comes down,#n#We mark the vengeful day begun, #n#And calmly wait the end.#n#
stanzas.3:
The plague, and dearth, and din of war,
Our Saviour's swift approach declare,#n#And bid our hearts arise;#n#Earth's basis shook, confirms our hope;#n#Its cities' fall but lifts us up,#n#To meet thee in the skies.#n#
stanzas.4:
Thy tokens we with joy confess;
The war proclaims thee Prince of Peace;#n#The earthquake speaks thy pow'r;#n#The famine all thy fulness brings;#n#The plague presents thy healing wings,#n#And nature's final hour.#n#
stanzas.5:
Whatever ills the world befall,
A pledge of endless good we call,#n#A sign of Jesus near.#n#His chariot will not long delay;#n#We hear the rumbling wheels, and pray,#n#"Triumphant Lord, appear!"#n#
stanzas.6:
Appear with clouds on Zion's hill,
Thy word and mystery to fulfil,#n#Thy children to approve;#n#Thy members on thy throne to place,#n#And stamp thy name on every face,#n#In glorious, heavenly love.#n#

stanzas.1:
Soldiers of Christ arise,
And put your armor on;#n#Fight. for the battle will be ours#n#We fight to win a crown.#n#
stanzas.2:
We fight not against flesh;
We wrestle not with blood;#n#But principalities and pow'rs,#n#And for the truth of God.#n#
stanzas.3:
With wicked spirits too,
That on high places stand,#n#Perverting oft the word of God,#n#And say 'tis by command.#n#
stanzas.4:
Put all the armor on
Like valiant soldiers stand— #n#Let all your loins be girt with truth,#n#Waiting our Lord's command.#n#
stanzas.5:
While Jesus is our Friend,
The Spirit is our guide,#n#Well march like valiant soldiers on;#n#We're sure to win the prize.#n#
stanzas.6:
The battle's almost o'er;
The race is nearly run;#n#Then, with our glorious conq'ring King,#n#We'll sit down on his throne.#n#

stanzas.1: Truth is the gem for which we seek!
stanzas.2:
We want the truth on every point;
We want it too to practice by.#n#Do thou, O Lord, our eyes anoint#n#With a fresh unction from on high.#n#
stanzas.3:
Were not the Ten Commandments given
By the great source of light and truth,#n#For ALL who tread the path to heav'n#n#From the dark wilderness of earth!#n#
stanzas.4:
Then as we would our God obey,
In letter and in spirit too,#n#O let us keep the seventh day,#n#For it is plainly brought to view.#n#

stanzas.1:
And when the last loud trumpet
Shall rend the vaulted skies,#n#And bid the entomb'd millions#n#From their cold beds arise,#n#Our ransom'd dust, revived,#n#Bright beauties shall put on,#n#And soar to the blest mansions#n#Where our Redeemer's gone.#n#
stanzas.2:
Our eyes shall then, with rapture,
The Saviour's face behold!#n#Our feet, no more diverted,#n#Shall walk the street of gold! #n#Our ears shall hear with transport#n#The hosts celestial sing!#n#Our tongues shall chant the glory#n#Of our immortal King.#n#

stanzas.1:
What heavenly music steals over the sea,
Entrancing the senses like sweet melody?#n#'Tis the voice of the angels borne soft on the air;#n#'Tis for me they are singing, their welcome I hear!#n#
stanzas.2:
On the banks of old Jordan here gazing I stand,
And earnestly longing I stretch forth my hand;#n#Send a convoy of angels, dear Jesus, I pray#n#Let me join that sweet music, come take me away.#n#
stanzas.3:
Though dark are the waters, and rough is the wave.
If Jesus permit, the wild surges I'll brave,#n#For that heavenly music hath ravish'd me so,#n#I must join in the chorus, I'll go, let me go.#n#

stanzas.1:
Jesus, I my cross have taken,
All to leave and follow thee;#n#All things else I have forsaken;#n#Thou from hence my all shalt be.#n#Perish every fond ambition,#n#All I've sought, or hop'd, or known;#n#Yet how rich is my condition,#n#While I prove the Lord my own.#n#
stanzas.2:
Let the world despise and leave me,
They have left my Saviour too;#n#Human hearts and looks deceive me,#n#Thou art faithful, thou art true.#n#O, 'tis not in grief to harm me,#n#While thy love is left to me;#n#
stanzas.3:
Haste thee on from grace to glory,
Arm'd by faith, and wing'd by pray’r;#n#Heaven's eternal day’s before thee;#n#God's own hand shall guide thee there#n#Soon shall close thy earthly mission,#n#Soon shall pass thy pilgrim days;#n#Hope shall change to glad fruition,#n#Faith to sight, and prayer to praise! #n#

stanzas.1:
I'm a pilgrim and I'm a stranger;
I can tarry, I can tarry, but a night;#n#Do not detain me, for I am going#n#To where the fountains are ever flowing,#n#I’m a pilgrim and I'm a stranger, &c.#n#
stanzas.2: There the glory is ever shining!
stanzas.3:
There's the city to which I journey;
My Redeemer, my Redeemer is its light!#n#There is no sorrow, nor any sighing,#n#Nor any tears there, nor any dying!#n#I'm a pilgrim, and I'm a stranger, &c.#n#
stanzas.4:
Farewell, dreary earth, by sin so blighted,
In immortal beauty soon you'll be arrayed!#n#He who has form'd thee, will soon restore thee!#n#And then thy dread curse shall never more be#n#I'm a pilgrim, and I'm a stranger,#n#Till thy rest shall end the weary pilgrim's night.#n#

stanzas.1:
O tell me no more
Of this world's vain store,#n#The time for such trifles#n#With me now is o'er.#n#
stanzas.2:
A city I've found
Where true joys abound;#n#To dwell I'm determin'd#n#On this happy ground.#n#
stanzas.3:
My soul, don't delay,
He calls thee away;#n#Rise, follow thy Saviour,#n#And bless the glad day.#n#

stanzas.1:
For Canaan I've started, and on I must go,
Till all the bright glories of Eden I know;#n#I've made no reserve, and I'm sure I'll not lack,#n#While onward I journey and do not draw back.#n#
stanzas.2:
Then on let us press, for Jesus is near,
And strengthen each other with words of good cheer;#n#With zeal ever buoyant and courage ne'er slack,#n#Let's be true to our King and never draw back.#n#

stanzas.1:
While I was down in Egypt's land,
I heard my Saviour was at hand;#n#And the midnight cry was sounding,#n#And I wanted to be free;#n#So I left my former brethren,#n#To sound the Jubilee.#n#
stanzas.2:
Though opposition waxes strong,
Yet still the battle won't be long,#n#For our blessed Lord is coming;#n#He will set the captives free;#n#Still keep up good courage, brethren,#n#And sound the Jubilee.#n#
stanzas.3:
The battle is not to the strong,
The weak may sing the conqueror's song;#n#Then lift lip your heads rejoicing,#n#Who are glad our Lord to see;#n#Bless the Lord, our souls are happy,#n#While we sound the Jubilee.#n#
stanzas.4:
A little longer here below,
Then home to glory we shall go, I believe it, I believe it.#n#Hallelujah now I see,#n#That we soon shall be with Jesus;#n#In the glorious Jubilee.#n#

stanzas.1:
Lo! He comes, with clouds descending,
Once for favor'd sinners slain,#n#Thousand, thousand angels shouting#n#Swell the triumph of His train;#n#Hallelujah! Jesus comes, and comes to reign;#n#Hallelujah! Jesus comes, and comes to reign.#n#
stanzas.2:
Every eye shall now behold Him,
Rob'd in dreadful majesty! #n#Those who set at nought and sold Him,#n#Pierc'd, and nail'd Him to the tree,#n#Deeply wailing,#n#Shall the true Messiah see!#n#
stanzas.3:
When the solemn trump has sounded,
Heaven and earth shall flee away;#n#All who hate Him must, confounded,#n#Hear the summons of that day—#n#Come to judgement!#n#Come to judgement! Come away!#n#
stanzas.4:
Yea, amen! Let all adore Thee,
High on Thy eternal throne!#n#Saviour, take the power and glory,#n#Make thy righteous sentence known,#n#O come quickly—#n#Claim the kingdom for thine own !#n#

stanzas.1:
Hear the glorious proclamation,
The glad tidings of salvation,#n#Hear the glorious proclamation,#n#Of the Saviour near.#n#CHORUS.#n#While the choir of angels,#n#While the choir of angels,#n#While the choir of angels,#n#Shall be chanting through the sky.#n#
stanzas.2:
Hark! The tidings onward rolling,
Jesus comes the world controlling!#n#Hark! The tidings onward rolling,#n#Jesus comes to reign.#n#
stanzas.3:
Suddenly a burst of thunder,
And the concave parts asunder,#n#Suddenly a burst of thunder,#n#And the skies depart.#n#
stanzas.4:
See the ‘sign’ in heaven appearing,
And the blazing chariot nearing.#n#See the ‘sign’ in heaven appearing,#n#And the Saviour there.#n#
stanzas.5:
See the earth in terror shaking,
And the dead to life awaking, #n#See the earth in terror shaking,#n#And the saints arise.#n#
stanzas.6:
Now on wings of light ascending
With a shining host attending,#n#Now on wings of light ascending,#n#See them mount the skies.#n#
stanzas.7:
See the banner waves in glory,
While ten thousand tell the story,#n#See the banner waves in glory,#n#And the saints are there.#n#
stanzas.8:
They are sav'd from death for ever,
Praise to him who did deliver,#n#They are sav'd from death forever,#n#And to die no, more.#n#

stanzas.1:
Rejoice, rejoice, the promis'd time is coming,
Rejoice, rejoice, the wilderness shall bloom;#n#And Zion's children then shall sing,#n#The deserts all are blossoming.#n#Rejoice, rejoice, the promis'd time is coming,#n#Rejoice, rejoice, the wilderness shall bloom;#n#King Jesus' banner wide unfurl'd,#n#Shall wave in triumph o'er the world,#n#And every Christian bond or free,#n#Shall hail the glorious jubilee.#n#Rejoice, rejoice, the promis'd time is coming,#n#Rejoice, rejoice, the wilderness shall bloom.#n#
stanzas.2:
Rejoice, rejoice, the promis'd time is coming,
Rejoice, rejoice, the “PRINCE OF PEACE” shall reign;#n#And lambs may with the leopard play,#n#For nought shall harm in Zion's way.#n#Rejoice, rejoice, the promis'd time is coming.#n#Rejoice, rejoice, the “PRINCE OF PEACE” shall reign#n#The sword and spear of needless worth,#n#Shall find no place in the new earth,#n#For Peace shall smile from shore to shore,#n#And nations shall learn war no more.#n#Rejoice, rejoice, the promis'd time is coming,#n#Rejoice, rejoice, the “PRINCE of PEACE” shall reign.#n#

stanzas.1:
Lo, what a glorious sight appears, 
To our believing eyes;#n#The earth and seas are pass'd away,#n#And the old rolling skies.#n#
stanzas.2:
From the third heav'n where God resides,
That holy, happy place;#n#The New Jerusalem comes down,#n#Adorn'd with shining grace.#n#
stanzas.3:
Attending angels shout for joy,
And the bright armies sing,#n#“Mortals behold the sacred seat#n#Of your eternal King!”#n#
stanzas.4:
How long, dear Saviour, O how long
Shall this bright hour delay?#n#Fly swift around, ye wheels of time,#n#And bring the welcome day.#n#

stanzas.1:
Thine earthly Sabbath, Lord, we love,
But there's a nobler rest above;#n#To that our laboring souls aspire,#n#With ardent hope, and strong desire.#n#
stanzas.2:
No more fatigue, no more distress,
No sin nor death can reach that place,#n#No tears shall mingle with the songs#n#That warble from immortal tongues.#n#
stanzas.3:
No rude alarm of raging foes,
No cares to break their long repose,#n#No midnight shade, no clouded sun,#n#But sacred high eternal noon.#n#
stanzas.4:
O long expected day begin,
Dawn on those realms of wo and sin;#n#Fain would I leave this weary road,#n#And go to meet my blessed Lord.#n#

stanzas.1:
Hail, peaceful morn, thy dawn I hail,
How do thy hours my mind regale#n#With feasts of heavenly joy;#n#Nor can I half Thy blessings name,#n#Which kindle in my soul a flame, #n#And all my powers employ.#n#
stanzas.2:
How shall I best improve thy hours?
Lord on me shed in copious showers#n#Thy Spirit, and Thy grace;#n#That when thy sacred courts I tread,#n#My soul may eat the heavenly bread.#n#And sing Jehovah's praise.#n#
stanzas.3:
Thou hallow'd season of repose,
Thou balm to soothe the throbbing woes,#n#Of this care-stricken breast;#n#Thy sacred hours I'll ever greet,#n#And with the faithful will I meet,#n#To taste Thy holy rest.#n#
stanzas.4:
Then to my chamber I'll repair,
With awe to talk with God in pray'r,#n#And all my griefs to tell;#n#His kind compassion will relieve,#n#His bounteous hand will mercies give,#n#And with the contrite dwell.#n#
stanzas.5:
Thus may the Sabbath pass away,
My best, my holiest, happiest day,#n#The sweetest of the seven;#n#But yet a rest for saints remains,#n#A Sabbath free from ills and pains,#n#Eternal, and in heaven.#n#

stanzas.1:
Hail the day so long expected,
Hail, the year of full release;#n#Zion's walls are now erected,#n#And her watchmen publish peace;#n#Throughout Shiloh's wide dominion,#n#Hear the trumpet loudly roar,#n#Babylon is fallen, is fallen, is fallen,#n#Babylon is fallen to rise no more.#n#
stanzas.2:
Come “my people” and forsake her,
Cast away your slavish fears;#n#Hear the voice from heaven proclaiming#n#It's the end of all her years.#n#Raise your voices she is fallen,#n#Lift your banners up on high, #n#Babylon is fallen, is fallen, is fallen, &c.#n#
stanzas.3:
Now her plagues are surely coming,
And her merchants all shall mourn;#n#All their merchandise shall fail them,#n#And with fire it shall burn;#n#Cry aloud, ye kings and nobles,#n#Priests and people, rich and poor,#n#Babylon is fallen, is fallen, is fallen, &c.#n#
stanzas.4:
Blow the trumpet in mount Zion,
Christ will come the second time,#n#Ruling with a rod of iron,#n#All who now his foes combine#n#Babel's garments we've rejected,#n#And the wedge of golden ore;#n#Babylon is fallen, is fallen, is fallen, &c.#n#

stanzas.1:
Bright crowns are just before us,
Then onward let us sing,#n#Jerusalem's bright seraphs ,#n#E’en now are on the wing.#n#
stanzas.2:
King Jesus and his angels,
Are hasting on their way,#n#To gather all the weary#n#Who faithful watch and pray.#n#
stanzas.3:
Toil on a little longer,
Stand stiffly for the word,#n#Oh ye, my fellow pilgrims,#n#The lov'd ones of my Lord.#n#
stanzas.4:
The kingdom, is the watchword,
We've almost reach'd our home,#n#Oh, glory hallelujah!#n#The Bride is saying Come.#n#

stanzas.1:
I'm glad I know that Christ shall reign
In glory, glory, glory;#n#And come to earth in clouds again,#n#In glory, glory, glory;#n#'Tis glory's fortaste makes me sing,#n#Of glory, glory, glory;#n#And to my Saviour praises bring #n#Sing glory, glory, glory.#n#
stanzas.2:
I hope to see Him on the throne
In glory, glory, glory;#n#When He shall come to claim his own,#n#In glory, glory, glory;#n#I'll sing while mounting through the air,#n#Of glory, glory, glory;#n#To meet my Father's children there,#n#In glory, glory, glory;#n#
stanzas.3:
Come on, dear friends, let's mend our pace,
To glory, glory, glory;#n#We soon shall see Him face to face,#n#In glory, glory, glory.#n#The Bride shall reign, the Bridegroom too,#n#In glory, glory, glory;#n#Let's keep the blessed prize in view,#n#'Tis glory, glory, glory.#n#

stanzas.1:
The appearing of Christ is good,
How good it is to me,#n#'Tis unlike the tyrant's rod,#n#His sceptre to see.#n#Let thy kingdom come,#n#Holy will on earth be done,#n#Saints gather'd in one,#n#When will it be?#n#
stanzas.2:
Our journey is to Canaan,
We are almost there,#n#The scoffs of the wicked then#n#Will be heard by none:#n#O how glorious#n#Are the promises for us,#n#Jesus, Thee we'll trust,#n#Conduct us home.#n#
stanzas.3:
I will look for that City, Lord,
I'll look and adore,#n#My longing eyes are turn'd toward.#n#That bright blissful shore,#n#Fruits immortal grow,#n#Tree of life is precious too,#n#My bark shall go through,#n#I want no more. #n#
stanzas.4:
No eye hath ever seen the like,
Of what we shall be,#n#He'll clothe us in garments bright,#n#How lovely to see.#n#Spotless, white and pure,#n#In the kingdom ever sure,#n#Foes cannot allure#n#How happy we.#n#

stanzas.1:
Come let us anew, our journey pursue,
Roll round with the year;#n#And never stand still, till the Master appear#n#And never stand still, till the Master appear.#n#
stanzas.2:
His adoreable will let us gladly fulfill,
And our talents improve,#n#By the patience of hope and the labor of love.#n#
stanzas.3:
Our life as a dream, our time as a stream,
Glides swiftly away,#n#And the fugitive moment refuses to stay.#n#
stanzas.4:
The arrow is flown, the moment is gone;
The millennial year#n#Rushes on to our view, and eternity's here.#n#
stanzas.5:
O that each in the day of his coming may say,
"I have fought my way through;#n#I have finish'd the work thou didst give me to do."#n#
stanzas.6:
O that each from his Lord may receive the glad word
“Well and faithfully done!#n#Enter into my joy, and sit down on my throne."#n#

stanzas.1:
Sweet is the work, my God, my King,
To praise thy name, give thanks, and sing!#n#To show thy love by morning light,#n#And talk of all thy truth by night.#n#
stanzas.2:
Sweet is the day of sacred rest;
No mortal cares shall seize my breast;#n#O may my heart in tune be found,#n#Like David's harp of solemn sound! #n#
stanzas.3:
When grace has purified my heart,
Then I shall share a glorious part;#n#And fresh supplies of joy are shed,#n#Like holy oil, to cheer my head.#n#
stanzas.4:
Then shall I see, and hear, and know,
All I desir'd or wish'd below;#n#And every hour find sweet employ,#n#In that eternal world of joy.#n#

stanzas.1:
“Are we almost there? Are we almost there?”
Says the weary saint, as he sighs for home;#n#“Are those the verdant trees that rear#n#Their stately forms' mid heav'n's bright dome?”#n#
stanzas.2:
Then he talks of the flowers, the unsullied stream,
That flows through the Paradise of God;#n#And he longs to wake from life's troubled dream,#n#To walk those golden streets abroad,#n#
stanzas.3:
He is weary and sick, of this world's rude strife;
And pants for a holy, peaceful clime;#n#To glow with the vigor of endless life,#n#And be compass'd no more by the bounds of time.#n#
stanzas.4:
His eye is fix’d on the world to come,
He walks by faith through this vale of care,#n#And oft inquires, as he draws near home,#n#With anxious heart, “Are we almost there?”#n#
stanzas.5:
For he's had an earnest of those joys
Which the righteous alone can ever share;#n#He turns with contempt from these earthly toys,#n#And fervently asks—“Are we almost there?”#n#
stanzas.6:
Then lift up thine head, rejoice and be glad,
For in that bright world thou'lt never be sad;#n#And thou shall pass from this world of strife#n#To the city fair, and the tree of life.#n#
stanzas.7:
Then lift up thy heart thou despairing saint,
The Lord will come, thou needs’t not faint,#n#For the Lord's own hand shall wipe from thy face#n#The last lone tear, and speak to thee peace. #n#

stanzas.1:
Praise God from Whom all blessings flow;
Praise Him all creatures here below;#n#Praise Him, above, ye heavenly host;#n#Praise Father, Son and Holy Ghost.#n#AMEN!

titles.15: THIS WORLD IS NOT MY HOME.
